title: Writing on the Medium App

Writing on the Medium App

Why I love using the Medium app to write stories.

Tanya Bryan
Apr 21

I recently wrote a piece on why I love using the Medium application as a reader. It’s built with the reader in mind with many functionalities that make the experience incredibly easy to read and share stories and articles by your favourite, and new favourite, Medium writers and publications. The notifications and the homepage make sure you’re in the know on all things Medium.

And although the app is missing many of the fabulous functions you can get with the web version (like directly adding Unsplash photos, sharing friend links, access to MPP information, etc.), it’s also a great app on which to write.

I wrote this entire dark humour piece while on transit. Usually writing fiction takes me a while to write, edit, then rewrite and format once I’ve put it up on Medium or other platforms to make it all look right with the spacing.

But writing in-app meant that I could see exactly where the text got too long for a small screen. I could add in line breaks, subheadings, and other formatting, making sure it looked right on my phone without fussing with it after it was written and possibly published. And writing on a smaller screen meant I kept the story short and punchy, which was exactly the tone I wanted for that piece.

And the bonus: I did all this while stuck in traffic!

Another thing I like doing in the app is starting drafts of stories. My writing goal is to publish more frequently and consistently on Medium. And keeping the drafts in one place versus various notebooks, texts, emails, and jotted down on whatever ephemera happened to be laying around is quite handy. I no longer have to dig to find that brilliant idea I came up with at the grocery store. It’s right there saved as a draft in my phone, ready for me to add to it, revise it, or put it aside for another day when I’ll have a brilliant idea to add to it.

I’ve noticed that my writing output is definitely more consistent since I’ve started doing this.

So, even though the app doesn’t have a few of the functions I’d love for it to include, I’m really enjoying using it as a productivity tool.

  • Writing
  • Writing Tips
  • Productivity
  • Writers On Writing

  • Tanya Bryan

    Builder of worlds with words. Short stories, poetry, books, arts and entertainment, movies, language, and creativity. https://linktr.ee/tanyabryan
